title: CACI to launch experimental satellite to demonstrate alternative to GPS navigation
summary: CACI International is funding an experiment to demonstrate space technologies for military use, including an alternative to GPS navigation.

title: As Centaur turns 60 years old, ULA prepares to evolve Centaur V
summary: 60 years ago, on May 8, 1962, Atlas-LV3C Centaur-A – designated Atlas Centaur-1 (AC-1) – lifted off from the newly-constructed Launch Complex-36A (LC-36A). AC-1 was the first flight test of the hydrogen-powered Centaur upper stage. Since the maiden flight of Centaur, the stage has flown on several different rocket families across six decades. Centaur has launched military, commercial, and science missions allowing access to every planetary body in the solar system and even beyond.

title: After losing contact with its helicopter, NASA put the entire Mars mission on hold
summary: Mars is only going to get colder and darker for the next 10 weeks as winter deepens.

title: SpaceX Super Heavy booster returns to launch pad after major repairs
summary: SpaceX has returned its newest Super Heavy to Starbase’s orbital launch site (OLS) after rapidly repairing damage suffered during the Starship booster’s...

title: Momentus receives approvals for first tug launch
summary: In-space transportation company Momentus has secured all the regulatory approvals for its first mission, set to launch later this month.

title: NASA defends decision to shut down SOFIA
summary: NASA officials say they believe the latest effort to shut down an airborne observatory is more likely to be successful because of the endorsement of doing so by last year’s decadal survey.

title: FAA and NTSB discussing roles in commercial spaceflight investigations
summary: Two federal agencies in a turf battle over commercial spaceflight investigations say they are now talking with each other to better define their roles and responsibilities.

title: 30 years after Intelsat VI rescue, Northrop Grumman aims to make in-space servicing a permanent reality
summary: On 7 May 1992, Space Shuttle Endeavour lifted off on her first voyage at 23:40 UTC from Pad-B at the Kennedy Space Center in Florida. Her target: Intelsat VI F-3 (now known as Intelsat 603). The goal: rendezvous with, repair, and re-release the satellite.

title: Astra prepares for TROPICS launch campaign
summary: Small launch vehicle developer Astra says it is ready to perform a series of launches for NASA once it receives a license for those missions.

title: Deep Blue Aerospace completes kilometer-level rocket launch and landing test
summary: A Chinese launch startup sent a small rocket test stage up to an altitude of one kilometer Friday before a performing a powered descent and vertical landing.
